metadata.title: Implement Patient Detail/Update API with Encrypted Fields

context.background: This task implements Implement Patient Detail/Update API with Encrypted Fields for Healio and is scoped as one atomic work item aligned to the PRD. It should be completed within 40 mins and leave clear evidence for follow-on tasks.

design_constraints.constraint: Follow the PRD architecture/security conventions and keep outputs compatible with the Healio design system and response envelopes.

instruction.step: Implement the scoped changes for Implement Patient Detail/Update API with Encrypted Fields in the planned files (healio/app/api/v1/patients/[id]/route.ts, healio/services/patientService.ts) while preserving the PRD-aligned project structure.
Apply validation, error handling, and consistent response/UI behavior so the task output integrates cleanly with existing helpers and patterns.
Wire integrations and dependencies for this task (endpoints: GET /api/v1/patients/:id, PATCH /api/v1/patients/:id) and keep tenant scoping/RBAC/security expectations intact where applicable.
Add or update focused tests (unit/integration) for critical business rules, idempotency, or security behavior introduced by this task.
Document assumptions and any follow-on schema/API contracts in code comments or lightweight docs when they affect downstream tasks.

validation_checklist.check: Exercise the related endpoint(s): GET /api/v1/patients/:id, PATCH /api/v1/patients/:id and verify response shape/status codes.
Run lint/typecheck or the smallest relevant test suite for the files changed by this task.
Validate security/tenant behavior with at least one negative test or rejection scenario when applicable.
Record evidence of persistence/side effects (DB row change, log entry, webhook event handling, cache behavior, etc.) as applicable.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: The deliverable for Implement Patient Detail/Update API with Encrypted Fields is implemented in the referenced files and compiles without breaking adjacent modules.
Task output matches the PRD scope (Feature 3 API Endpoints) and remains bounded to an atomic <=45-minute implementation chunk.
Related endpoint behavior returns the standard success/error envelope and respects auth/public route expectations for the route class.
Business rules, tenant scoping, and security constraints relevant to this task are enforced (validation, idempotency, RBAC, webhook/cron protection, etc.).
At least one verification artifact (test case, curl call, or fixture-driven check) proves the new behavior works and regressions are covered.

execution_tracking.verification_command: npm run typecheck; node --import tsx --test tests/unit/patient-detail-route.test.ts
execution_tracking.verification_notes: Implemented protected patient detail/update route with standard envelopes and middleware auth-header enforcement. Reused the patientService encrypted-field storage/decryption path so GET/PATCH responses return decrypted sensitive values while preserving encrypted-at-rest internal storage. Added route tests covering GET/PATCH success, encrypted-field update/readback, invalid id, missing auth, and empty patch validation failures.

evidence.item: When work starts/completes, record changed files, test commands, screenshots (UI tasks), and commit/PR references here.

Changed files: healio/app/api/v1/patients/[id]/route.ts, healio/tests/unit/patient-detail-route.test.ts, plus generated healio/tsconfig.tsbuildinfo (patientService/schema support was implemented in prior task HEALIO-033 and reused here).

Endpoint verification: `node --import tsx --test tests/unit/patient-detail-route.test.ts` passed; covers GET /api/v1/patients/:id (200), PATCH encrypted fields + notes (200), invalid patient id (400), missing auth (401), and empty patch (400).

Encrypted-field behavior verified via API responses: created/updated `phone`, `allergies`, and `chronicConditions` are returned decrypted while service storage remains encrypted at rest (implemented in HEALIO-033 patientService).
Implementation commit: 74e034e (feat(healio-patients): patient detail update route).
